geeklist.title: Aussie Mid Year Math(s) Trade 2013
geeklist.description:
Welcome to the Mid Year Aussie Math(s) Trade 2013.
Team behind this MT is:
[floatleft][username=Friendless][/floatleft][floatleft][username=mr_lunch][/floatleft][floatleft][username=Amiguero][/floatleft][clear]
[b][size=14]Rules:[/size][/b]
:d10-1: This trade is open to Australian BGGers only.
:d10-2: This trade is open to board games, expansions, card games, game accessories, RPG, video games and the like. Please don't add anything else. If you intend to allow a game to be exchanged for cash (i.e. you're selling), include the amount you will accept for it in the price. You may consider compare current market prices (ebay, BGG, local shop)
:d10-3: Golden rule: [b][size=12]SENDER PAYS SHIPPING[/size][/b]. Even if you're selling a game for cash, or you post from Perth to Townsville or Hobart. So, make sure you set your price high enough that you would be happy to pay shipping to anywhere else in Australia out of that money. By posting an item to this list you are agreeing that you can and will mail it anywhere in Australia at your expense.
:d10-4: Items included in the maths trade are expected to remain as part of the maths trade until the closing date. If your intention is to sell an item there are other alternatives in BGG to do so. If an item is not longer available for whatever reason, please indicate so with big letters. If you decide to drop an item from the list, please do so before the due date of the game submission deadline. List order will be as per submissions. Note: your items could end up with a different item number due to deletions, so please check the official after the geeklist has been closed. Refer to the deadlines below.
:d10-5: Cash option once agains is available.
:d10-6: Math Traders will not be required to add cash items to the geeklist - that will be handled in the want lists. In the case that a buyer offers more than a seller is asking, the buyer will pay the seller's price.
:d10-7: Australian BGGers can participate even without submitting an item to the trade with the cash option by submitting want list before the due date.
:d10-8: Provide as much details as possible (edition, language, sleeved cards, condition of the game, etc). Pick a picture that represents the game you're offering if there are multiple versions. If necessary, take a picture of the game, upload it to your gallery, and use that image. Feel free to use the game condition rating previously suggested by petegs to describe your items:
[b]New in shrink[/b] - which means never opened. [b]Opened but unpunched[/b] - I've looked at the game but not punched counters yet or stickered blocks etc. [b]Opened and punched[/b] - Looked at, even punched counters etc but haven't played. [b]Opened and played[/b].
Count pieces to make sure the games are complete, and accurately list any components that are missing or damaged. Please look at your trade pile to make sure the game is really there. In order to make your items more (or less) appealing, you may want to add one or more "sweeteners" to the item listing -- an expansion, a related game, or a completely unrelated item that you think will make it a more desirable package. Items for which there is no BGG listing can be listed as Miscellaneous Game Accessory. Please remember to link the sweeteners so the want lists tools can pick them up.
[b]Important:[/b] Use BGG image galleries rather than external hosting for your pics since we have access to scaling then, and this page will load faster.
:d10-9: There is no limit of items to be submitted in this trade. Duplicates of items already on the list are fine. Traders can combine multiple games into one item (e.g. 7 Wonders plus expansions).
:d10-1::d10-0: Keep comments for listed items to a minimum. There is a separate thread for any ad hoc messages and to post the results.
[COLOR=#0000CC][size=12][geekurl=/thread/964916/aussie-mid-year-maths-trade-2013]Aussie Mid Year Maths Trade Discussion[/geekurl][/size][/COLOR]
[b][size=14]Deadlines:[/size][/b]
Add items to the list by: [size=12][b][-]10pm Sunday 26 May 2013[/-][/b][/size]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time
Official item list posted by: [size=12][-][b]10pm Monday 27 May 2013[/b][/-][/size]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time
Want Lists due by: [-][size=12][b]10pm Thursday 30 May 2013[/b].[/size][/-] EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time
[COLOR=#000099][b]Want list submission via GeekMail to[/b] [/COLOR]
[user=Friendless][/user]
Official Results posted at Friendless discretion from Sunday 2 June 2013.
No extensions for deadlines above will be granted. For respect to your fellow Math Traders and to have enough time as people may need to get their games to a willing 'games mule' attending BorderCon and/or T&GE.
[i]Packing tips:[/i]
- Make sure the game contents are secure [i]inside[/i]the game and won't shift around. - Place the game in a plastic bag to prevent water damage (in the event it is left out in the rain). - Make sure there's cushioning around all side of the game. - Use a proper box. (Auspost "ToughBags" won't prevent crushing.) - Make sure the box is properly taped up. - Make sure the address is clear and won't get torn off.
[i]Wiki:[/i]
If you require further details about Math(s) Trade information and how to prepare your want list, please refer to the [geekurl=/wiki/page/Aussie_Maths_Trade#]Aussie Maths Trade Wiki[/geekurl].
Finally, please let others know that Aussie math(s) trade is now open.
Thank you all for your participation.
[size=12][BGCOLOR=#FF0000]Update 1.[/BGCOLOR] Please do not DELETE your game items now. MT is Closed and traders are preparing want list. If you don't want your games to be traded, submit and 'empty' list.[/size]
[size=14][BGCOLOR=#FF0000]Update 2.[/BGCOLOR] Math(s) Trade result can be found in the following links:[/size]
http://boardgamegeek.com/article/12437634#12437634
http://friendless.servegame.org/stats/result.html

Try AusPost [b][url=https://www.clickandsend.com.au/AustraliaPost/]ClickAndSend[/url][/b] (max weight 15kg), flat rate Australia wide if required, as guide to cost (including box, packing materials, postage). Same rate to send from Townsville QLD to Kalgoorlie WA or Brisvegas QLD. Free online tracking included, add $2.95 for signature on delivery. There is no reason to pay or charge more:
[c][b]Box Width Depth Height Post Cost Box Cost C&S Code[/b] Bx1 220mm 160mm 77mm $7.15 $1.75 00069 Bx2 310mm 225mm 102mm $11.70 $2.35 00076 Bx4 430mm 305mm 140mm $15.05 $3.20 00090[/c] [hr]For the person sending, they need to register. Their interface will infuriate the hell out of technically competent people. and you will need to enter one of the promo codes: B1: 00069, B2: 00076, B4: 00090 and hit
[size=12][BGCOLOR=#868686][COLOR=#FFFFFF] Search [/COLOR][/BGCOLOR][/size]
(Using example of 00090 B4) It will then auto fill details such as: [floatleft][b]Packaging type[/b] [hr]AP/eBay FLAT RATE Bx4 Box[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Weight[/b] [hr]15.000 kg[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Length[/b] [hr]43.00 cm[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Width[/b] [hr]30.50 cm[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Height[/b] [hr]14.00 cm[/floatleft] [clear]If you do that it will then give you the promo pricing as well as fill in the dimensions. Pricing will appear once you select.
[size=12][BGCOLOR=#FF3300][COLOR=#FFFFFF] Search available services [/COLOR][/BGCOLOR][/size].
[b][COLOR=#FF0000]* Prices effective April 8, 2013[/COLOR][/b]

Going off on a tangent, it is usual for there to be a rush, close to the closing deadline, of people listing games at the last minute (I know I've have just used a tautology).
Why do people do this?
Surely if you want to list a game you want to do it sooner rather than later so as to give other geeks as much time as possible to mull over the possibilities of making a trade with you.
=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*=====*
Going off on a different tangent, John, why have the results of the trade finalized only a few days before BorderCon? Personally, I leave for BorderCon on Saturday June 1st. Yes, it takes me a week to make it from Port Macquarie to Albury - I have a lot of people to visit on the way. Posting the results on June 2nd means that I won't see the results until I am a long way from home.
Do others feel that just three days notice between finalizing the trade and attending BorderCon is a tad counterproductive?

[q="da pyrate"]...it is usual for there to be a rush, close to the closing deadline, of people listing games at the last minute (I know I've have just used a tautology).
Why do people do this?[/q] Speaking for myself:
[microbadge=9655] I like to spend some time contemplating my collection before listing any of my games. I'm not a hoarder, but I am nostalgic and I can probably tell you off the top of my head where each and every one of my possessions came from. Sometimes I find it difficult to let things go.
[microbadge=9365] I'm also a procrastinator. This is not a good combination. :shake:
[q="da pyrate"]...Do others feel that just three days notice between finalizing the trade and attending BorderCon is a tad counterproductive?[/q] I hadn't actually noticed. It won't affect me much, but I agree that it's possibly cutting it a bit fine.

I'll have a look to the list to see if there is any item unavailable that can be deleted. Please let me know if you see any of those.
I don't think deletion will change codes, so you could start working on want list now.
EDIT: After deadline tomorrow, no further comments would be allowed to the MT.

[q="Neil Thomson"] So is this a record? [/q]
Yes and no.
Yes it's a record for a mid-year maths trade in Australia.
No it isn't a record for all maths trades in Australia. The year end ones traditionally attract more items (as you know Neil).
However overall the newcomers have boosted this one significantly and it places third all time on the Aussie wide maths trade list.
Keep in mind that of the 12 we've conducted (as far as I know) this is only the second one that has had entries removed when pre-trades/sales have occured. Previously they were left in place, which means that earlier maths trades had fewer items available than the final number indicates.
For the record:
#1: [url=http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/75364/item/1975514#item1975514]The Australian Year End Math Trade 2011[/url] [b]1036 Items[/b]
#2: [url=http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/148789/item/2456313#item2456313]The Australian Year End Math(s) Trade 2012[/url] [b]1022 Items[/b]
#3: [url=http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/156213/item/2663666#item2663666]Aussie Mid Year Math(s) Trade 2013[/url] [b]854 items[/b]
#4: [url=http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/140281/item/2153089#item2153089]The Australian Mid Year Math Trade 2012[/url] [b]690 items[/b]
#5: [url=http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/61984/item/1528471#item1528471]Australian Maths Trade, Christmas 2010, now with CASH![/url] [b]664 items[/b]

Made it this time. I'm learning to organise my life around these maths trades but its hard. I would prefer we had 2 days only to put items up. That would get people fired up! Anyhow remember my philosophy
Cash is King, the rest is just conversation.

[q="Amiguero"] Last week to submit items for trade to the list.[/q]
When Rene posted this there were ~350 items (hard to tell with deletions). That means approx 500 items were added in the last 7 days (out of the 36 days this list was open). Perhaps a 2 week window is in order next time?

[q="tiggers"][q="Amiguero"] Last week to submit items for trade to the list.[/q]
When Rene posted this there were ~350 items (hard to tell with deletions). That means approx 500 items were added in the last 7 days (out of the 36 days this list was open). Perhaps a 2 week window is in order next time?
[/q]
It happens every time and it is ridiculous. Don't these people realize how much more difficult they make it for organizers by dumping all this information on the list at the last minute.
When I was doing this it would take ages to add the codes and being able to do it earlier certainly made it easier than having to stay up late at the last minute.

[q="da pyrate"][q="tiggers"][q="Amiguero"] Last week to submit items for trade to the list.[/q]
When Rene posted this there were ~350 items (hard to tell with deletions). That means approx 500 items were added in the last 7 days (out of the 36 days this list was open). Perhaps a 2 week window is in order next time?
[/q]
It happens every time and it is ridiculous. Don't these people realize how much more difficult they make it for organizers by dumping all this information on the list at the last minute.
When I was doing this it would take ages to add the codes and being able to do it earlier certainly made it easier than having to stay up late at the last minute.
[/q]
The simple solution I guess is to make the deadline a week earlier than the organisers need it to be so they have the time.
Given how many items are added in the last week I don't think dropping a week off would be a bad thing as people are obviously needing a deadline to get their butts into gear.
Making it too short though can be problematic as some people actually want to see some items up before they go to the effort.
I actually think that this trade had a real sense of 'oh great stuff on there, I'll need to match it if I want a chance to win some of it'.

There was a lot of great stuff...I think much better without the hordes of video games that were in the previous list.
One thing that continues to surprise me is the number of cheap games listed as single items. Looking at them, it would be cheaper for me to simply purchase them from Milsims rather than look to trading and suffer the cost of posting items that goes side-by-side with that.

[q="da pyrate"]There was a lot of great stuff...I think much better without the hordes of video games that were in the previous list.
One thing that continues to surprise me is the number of cheap games listed as single items. Looking at them, it would be cheaper for me to simply purchase them from Milsims rather than look to trading and suffer the cost of posting items that goes side-by-side with that.
[/q]
It's a balancing act. What you say is true, but I'm wary of trading for a pile of games, only one of which I want, and imagine there are others like me. Besides, if small items trade for small items, shouldn't the postage be reasonable for both parties?

[q="da pyrate"]...the hordes of video games that were in the previous list...[/q] Actually there were only nine video games listed last time - hardly a horde. And if they (or any of the 'cheap games listed as single items') end up resulting in more trades, that's a good thing. Having a bunch of items on the list that you're not interested in doesn't actually make it harder for you to snag the games you [i]are[/i] interested in.

[q="earlyworm"][q="da pyrate"]...the hordes of video games that were in the previous list...[/q] Actually there were only nine video games listed last time - hardly a horde. And if they (or any of the 'cheap games listed as single items') end up resulting in more trades, that's a good thing. Having a bunch of items on the list that you're not interested in doesn't actually make it harder for you to snag the games you [i]are[/i] interested in.[/q]
Nines a horde - large group, multitude, or number. I would suggest it meets the definition. :laugh:

[q="da pyrate"]Don't these people realize how much more difficult they make it for organizers by dumping all this information on the list at the last minute.[/q]
You're out of date David, we have programs for all that now. I think time will be a bit tight for people to get their want lists together, but I've planned to not go out any evening this week so I can compile the lists and get back to people with errors ASAP. This evening I'll post the first of the "these people haven't submitted their wants lists" posts. The trade codes were up about 23 hours early, while Ben was comfortably renovating his house :-).
Edit: and in fact all 3 organisers added items on the last day!

[q="Friendless"][q="da pyrate"]Don't these people realize how much more difficult they make it for organizers by dumping all this information on the list at the last minute.[/q]
You're out of date David, [/q]
So its official then. :p

[q="Fronk"]Nines a horde - large group, multitude, or number. I would suggest it meets the definition. :laugh:[/q] Ha, I suppose so. Funnily enough my notion of what constitutes a horde was wholly shaped by a video game - Heroes of Might & Magic II - which used the following numbering system for its stacks of monsters:
"Few" = 0 to 4 "Several" = 5 to 9 "Pack" = 10 to 19 "Lots" = 20 to 49 "Horde" = 50 to 99 "Throng" = 100 to 249 "Swarm" = 250 to 499 "Zounds" = 500 to 999 "Legion" = 1000 to 32767
Using this system, the previous maths trade had a legion of items, of which merely several were video games. Meanwhile, I was romping around with my unstoppable army containing a legion of skeletons and a throng of vampire lords. Good times.
Is the trade verifier up and running?

[q="Fronk"][q="Friendless"][q="da pyrate"]Don't these people realize how much more difficult they make it for organizers by dumping all this information on the list at the last minute.[/q]

[q="da pyrate"] One thing that continues to surprise me is the number of cheap games listed as single items. Looking at them, it would be cheaper for me to simply purchase them from Milsims rather than look to trading and suffer the cost of posting items that goes side-by-side with that. [/q]
It's the main reason why I've decided to group a few games together in this MT. Living in regional Australia, the cost of shipping just doesn't justify looking at those smaller/cheaper items. The flip-side of this is it's hard to get 2-3 items into a bundle that will all interest the same person.
Another funny thing is, browsing through the list, when I see a game I love with 'Still in shrink' or 'Only played once', I think to myself 'Oh, if only they could play that wonderful game, they'd love it'.
is it too late to combine two items?

I don't think Coxy is out of date... Maybe stale or off is a better description :p

[q="Critical Mass"]is it too late to combine two items? [/q]
Yes, please check the deadline date on the header. :sauron:

[q="da pyrate"][q="tiggers"][q="Amiguero"]Last week to submit items for trade to the list.[/q]When Rene posted this there were ~350 items (hard to tell with deletions). That means approx 500 items were added in the last 7 days (out of the 36 days this list was open). Perhaps a 2 week window is in order next time?[/q]It happens every time and it is ridiculous. Don't these people realize how much more difficult they make it for organizers by dumping all this information on the list at the last minute.[/q]Actually, as the codes are now auto generated by a lunch-box tool, last minute add has minimal impact.
More a case of when you get a burst of codes being applied, if you have the list as a subscription, you will have a huge wad of "new items/comment" to wade through or mark as read.

[q="da pyrate"]One thing that continues to surprise me is the number of cheap games listed as single items. Looking at them, it would be cheaper for me to simply purchase them from Milsims rather than look to trading and suffer the cost of posting items that goes side-by-side with that.[/q]If, as in the spirit of this maths-trade, most items channel through BorderCon via an efficient muling system, then postage is little of an issue.
Personally, I think both the person sending and receiving has an obligation to work together to optimise the shipping charges and bundling via BorderCon.

Edit: I've had offers to buy this from me, but I actually want a game for it :-). So I am open to pre-trade offers, but only for games... and please make some effort, don't just ask me "is there anything on my trade list you'd like?", because I've probably already looked.

item.comment: Well, you certainly know how to make your offerings sound tempting. ;)

I'm abandoning all Queen Games until I get my English cards for [thing=16496][/thing]. (Probably a grievance best discussed elsewhere.)
Seriously though - Queen Games are great... for storage. You can usually fit ten other games in one of their big box games - plus the original game! It's a bargain! Strangely my memory isn't what it was and I've now misplaced several of my smaller games. So if anyone has bought any of my Queen Games big box games, you should open the box (no, not to play it silly ), and you might find a good game inside.
[size=7]*Please note that I've never played [thing=691][/thing] and it might be an awesome game. Not meaning to rain of Jenny's parade. Warning: Some parts may cause cancer, but probably only in California.[/size]

[q="Scholle"]I'm abandoning all Queen Games until I get my English cards for [thing=16496][/thing]. (Probably a grievance best discussed elsewhere.)[/q]
Digressing even more, if you emailed Nikki from Queen Games again on kickstarter she maybe able to help. I got my new ones recently after emailing her again about half a month ago. Was pleasantly surprised when it actually turned up.

[q="smittenkitten"](It's obvious that I am deserting Queen Games - all chrome and jack crap all else) [/q] It actually just looks like you have managed to get all of the awful Queen games (Colonia! :gulp:) and dodged all of the great ones (Lancaster, Chicago Express, etc.). Lancaster doesn't even have free space in the box!

Lindsay - exactly. I've lost a few card games that way precisely. Lucky these are shrinkwrapped still!
Roma is one of their best games, for sure. I just feel like the bulk of their games are just abstracts with nice themes and beautiful box art pasted on. And I just noticed I forgot to list Eketorp. Ha.

[q="smittenkitten"]I just feel like the bulk of their games are just abstracts with nice themes and beautiful box art pasted on.[/q]
You say that like it's a bad thing. I would happily make a pre-trade trade with you if your want list wasn't COMPLETELY EMPTY.
What's a want list? I want everything. Just look at my wishlist. :D In fact,I will check out your trade list.

Pretty sure the base game would go in a flash at the least though.

[q="Neil Thomson"]Pretty sure the base game would go in a flash at the least though.[/q]
Then you're stuck trying to get rid of the expansions by themselves. I've been there, regretted that.
(Edit: Fixed typo.)

[q="cyberkev63"]Then you're stuck trying to get rid of the expansions by themselves. I've been there, regretted that.[/q] I reckon that's unlikely to be an issue. GMT has been pretty good about keeping the base game in print but that is not true of the expansions. If anything they are probably in greater demand.

I want Expansion #1, but none of the rest. FWiW, I think the expansions are OOP once again, although GMT will get them back in production pretty soon. #1 is $80+ on eBay.
Offering the whole lot together is certainly going to make it one of the most valuable items. Will watch with interest.

The reprints currently have a production slot in July.

item.comment: Some trivia: At the time of my working at Walrus, there were 9 pallets of this game when the 'ship' finally sank. Also, we printed up an award for a Mind Games in QLD for selling over 100 copies of it. How on Earth? :laugh:

Lots of "occasional" gamers seem to have copies, and (shudder) a couple of years back it was frequently recommended for kids in their early teens. Since Talisbloop is only tolerable when consuming large quantities of alcohol, this never seemed like a good fit - but nonetheless...
I loved 1st ed (with many 2nd ed expansions) as a pre-teen and teen. I just found the game too slow and random as an adult.

[q="smittenkitten"]Some trivia: At the time of my working at Walrus, there were 9 pallets of this game when the 'ship' finally sank. Also, we printed up an award for a Mind Games in QLD for selling over 100 copies of it. How on Earth? :laugh:[/q]Gift with purchase perhaps? :cool:

[q="Ozludo"]Lots of "occasional" gamers seem to have copies, and (shudder) a couple of years back it was frequently recommended for kids in their early teens.[/q] I have a description for a bunch of games which is "teenage boy game". Talisman fits. A game that goes on and on and on, usually with constant fighting.
The sort of game that I would have loved playing (endlessly) as a teenage boy, but would not be likely to play so often now.

I have a friend with 2nd edition plus all expansions. When I mentioned the length issue to him he said that he and his sons are so familiar with the game and its expansions that they know just where to go and the game goes much quicker than the base game alone as everyone levels up really fast.
That would be the Talisman City 2nd ed expansion.
Actually the one he said made the biggest difference was Dragons. They enabled everyone to level up very quickly and so get to the end without a lot of fuss.

item.comment: I'd be happy to offer you cash for this. I'm quite new to this thread and don't really know how it works. Prob best if you can inbox me? I think I subscribed to this thread though :-)

Jules, to make that offer through the maths trade, you would send me a message something like this:
(Addicted2EuroGames) $500: 2630454-MRJAC (Addicted2EuroGames) LIMIT: $1000
which says "I offer $500 for this item, and I don't want to spend more than $1000 no matter what". You could include as many items from the trade as you like. You may pay less than $500, depending on what the other person asks for.
Note: numbers used here for illustrative purposes and are not indicative of true value of games. :devil:

item.comment: Ive never actuallg played Summoner Wars; Are these decks all you need to be able to play, or do you need a 'base' set first?

That's right. Either one of these by themselves is enough for a 2 player game. With both you can play with 4 players (if you really want) or just mix and match for 2 players. They both come with (fairly crappy, but that's not my fault - that's what they are) paper "boards" folded up in the pack. They are very unimpressive but eminently functional for the game.

[b]This is NOT an official version of Up Front, nor is it a complete copy of the game.[/b]
It is a collection of about 350+ cards based on davidmps's unofficial re-design of the cards (see here: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/458796/up-front-redesign).
Essentially I waited years for Up Front to be reprinted, then decided to bite the bullet and reprint the redesign through artscow.
As a result, I have 7 decks of 54 cards. This includes the complete Action deck, the Personality cards, plus some extra blanks that I printed off [just in case I later lost or damage a card].
I should clarify, it doesn't have the expansions, it's just the base Up Front (ie: Germans, Russians and Americans), but for each of these forces there appear to be are a few extra cards over what was in the original base game.
This does not include rules or counters (though it would be easy to print those off).
The one minor problem with these cards is that there should be A (1-5), A (6-10, B(1-5), B (6-10). But instead of this I've printed 2x A (1-5), 2x B (1-5), etc, so 10 cards have 'A' instead of 'B' on them. This is easily 'patched' (and I can do it for anyone interested).
I'm happy to answer any queries about these. Essentially I lost interest in the game so never completed it, but thought somebody might want them (can I emphasise how awesome the redesigned cards look).

[b]Glory To Rome: Black Box: The Apology Letter![/b]
Excellent Condition.
This is a handwritten letter (addressed to me and dated 19 June, 2012) from Ed Carter, Managing Director of Cambridge Games Factory. (It includes the address of the house he no longer owns.) Individuals who pledged at certain levels of the (disastrous) Kickstarter campaign were given the benefit of receiving this letter. It was supposed to be an apology for inflicting the art from the original version of the game on the game-buying public. But, after all the troubles of the Kickstarter campaign, it ended up being an apology for the late deliveries of the game to Australia. (So, even the apology letter was not what it was advertised to be...)
Now you can own a piece of Kickstarter and Glory To Rome history!
$20 for the maths trade (which includes shipping, of course).
I'm open to offers before the finalisation of the maths trade. I'll be at Bordercon!
item.comment: My thumb is to indicate appreciation, not interest. (I have my own Ed Carter letter I'll always treasure...)

This is a card game produced through the IndieGoGo crowdfunding website. You are trying to have your Survivors outrun the Zombie Horde (and the other Survivors) to get to the safety of the bunker. It's kind of like Guillotine with zombies, but with much more control and less chaos. It's fun!
$20 for the maths trade (which includes shipping, of course).
I'm open to offers before the finalisation of the maths trade. I'll be at Bordercon!

The rules for the game can be found here: http://www.educationallearninggames.com/how-to-play-smart-mouth-game-rules.asp (scroll down)
